response.description: Statements documents are financial reports providing a broader overview of accounts, focusing on capital accounts, end-of-period balances, and performance metrics. - These are typically comprehensive and cover capital account summaries, management fees, realized/unrealized gains or losses, and net income over specified periods. - Statements might include partner capital breakdowns, beginning and ending capital balances, contributions, withdrawals, net trading profits or losses, and realized and unrealized gains. - They often contain sections on administrative fees, management fees, incentive allocations, performance metrics, and net returns, as well as gain and loss attribution details. - The documents highlight net performance returns, rates of return, and sometimes compare new income allocations to historical figures. - Statements documents can provide additional support and context in the form of capital account schedules, commitment summaries, fee calculations, and details on investor commitments. - These documents are more analytical, including supplementary notes, performance analysis, and investor breakdowns, often showing allocation across multiple investor entities or fund components. - The emphasis is on an overall account analysis with financial implications over various periods, addressing both internal and regulatory perspectives, and sometimes providing specific notes on tax and valuation impacts.

Account.description: This is the fund name and investor name combined in a piped format. For instance, if fund name is 'ABC Investments' and investor is 'Scott', then account is 'ABC Investments|Scott'.

AccountRefID.description: Unique reference identifier linking to the specific account in the account master table

Commitment.description: Total capital amount the investor has legally committed to invest in the fund over its life

CommitmentOnlyStatement.description: Flag indicating if statement shows only commitment info (no transactions)

ContributionOutsideCommitment.description: Capital call amount that exceeds the investor's original commitment (typically requires special consent)

ContributionsToDate.description: Total cumulative capital contributions made by the investor from inception to date

Currency.description: ISO 4217 three-letter currency code for the transaction (e.g., USD, EUR, GBP)

Investor.description: Human-readable name or description of the investor (individual, entity, or institution name)

InvestorRefID.description: Unique reference identifier linking to the specific investor in the investor master table

IRR.description: Internal Rate of Return as percentage (e.g., 15.2500 for 15.25%)

ManagementFee.description: Management fees charged for the period

NetCapitalActivity.description: Net change in capital (contributions minus distributions)

NetClosingCapital.description: Net capital balance at period end

NetOpeningCapital.description: Net capital balance at period start

OtherAdjustments.description: Miscellaneous adjustments to capital account (can be negative)

OtherIncomeLoss.description: Other income or losses not classified elsewhere (can be negative)

Price.description: NAV per unit or share price (4-6 decimal precision)

Quantity.description: Number of units/shares held (4-6 decimal precision)

RealizedGainLoss.description: Gains/losses from completed transactions (can be negative)

Security.description: Identifier or name of the fund, investment vehicle, or security involved in the transaction

TransfersIn.description: Capital amount transferred into the account (e.g., from another investor or account)

TransfersOut.description: Capital amount transferred out of the account (e.g., to another investor or account)

UnrealizedGainLoss.description: Gains/losses from mark-to-market valuation (can be negative)

ConfidenceScore.description: Confidence score for the extracted value.

VerbatimText.description: The exact verbatim text extracted from the document.
